metadata.title: CVE-2022-1529 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An attacker could have sent a message to the parent process where thecontents were used to double-index into a JavaScript object, leading toprototype pollution and ultimately attacker-controlled JavaScript executingin the privileged parent process. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR <91.9.1, Firefox < 100.0.2, Firefox for Android < 100.3.0, and Thunderbird <91.9.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1529` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 100.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 100.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 100.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '100.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
